body: long, but so great. remembered me of Odissey, when Odisseus wants to be released from the Nymph's control

That was saddening. Douglas was nothing but a good friend, he was there for him when no one else was, yet it seems Ashton completely forgot about that. Be it Stockholm syndrome or vampiric enthrallment, too warped to recognize the friend he had or even see himself in the child of his friend. 

It's a well written story, it's just leaves a bad taste in my mouth (heart). Can't and shouldn't be happy for the protagonist honestly.

The ending ruined pretty much everything, just a sadist roller coaster that kills any mood just like the monster he became. Vampires are among the easiest monsters to write as coexisting with humans, so all this murder shit is very lame, specially the Douglas and his kid. *sigh*
I agree, the new one is so much cleaner. Lets hope that someone will translate the new one since this might be my fav hentai of all time too.

This is my favorite hentai doujin of all time. There's a remake here that was released recently 342131 that hasn't been decensored and translated yet. The art is a lot better, the story is more fleshed out, everything is colored, and it feels more complete. Here's hoping for a translation and decensor soon.

When I first started reading this I had no idea it would progress in such a way. The development in the beginning felt really natural and had a great plot (I think). Really only expected to come and bust rq but otherwise got an amazing story.

Excellent read, but for me, the ending destroyed more than 100 pages of character development. It'd have been much greater if he had kept at least a fragment of himself and just lived happily with her instead of becoming an apathetic killer.
I came here to nut, but left as a new person
Magnum opus
I love the story and I love the art but the story being tallied in massive paragraph was not something I like but it's a fantastic story and manga good job kouji

"He'd wondered if there was anything he wanted to do while he was still human, But nothing came to mind."
